item.title: Hacker News Top Stories: Sunday, March 2, 2025 at 2:15 PM UTC
item.description:
1. The early days of Linux (2023) (321 points | 78 comments)
2. The most unhinged video wall, made out of Chromebooks (477 points | 43 comments)
3. ‘Slime’ keeps the brain safe ― and could guard against ageing (82 points | 28 comments)
4. The three-dimensional Kakeya conjecture, after Wang and Zahl (29 points | 1 comment)
5. Crossing the uncanny valley of conversational voice (297 points | 151 comments)
6. How Flash games shaped the video game industry (2020) (171 points | 98 comments)
7. Show HN: Berlin Swapfest – Electronics flea market (260 points | 49 comments)
8. Free introns of tRNAs as complementarity-dependent regulators of gene expression (12 points | discuss)
9. Knowing CSS is mastery to Front end Development (70 points | 76 comments)
10. The A.I. Monarchy (74 points | 68 comments)
11. Firefly Blue Ghost Mission 1 Lunar Landing (128 points | 31 comments)
12. A cross-platform multi-target dotfiles manager written in Rust (59 points | 47 comments)
13. Euclid finds complete Einstein Ring in NGC galaxy (128 points | 34 comments)
14. Mozilla flamed by Firefox fans after reneging on promises to not sell their data (121 points | 70 comments)
15. Show HN: I made a website where you can create your own "Life in Weeks" timeline (203 points | 54 comments)
16. Show HN: Robyn – “Batman Inspired” Python Web Framework Built with Rust (52 points | 40 comments)
17. AlgoMIDI – A Mathematical 'Music Studio' (53 points | 7 comments)
18. NIH.gov DNS servers down, making PubMed, BLAST, etc. unreachable (326 points | 226 comments)
19. Reimagining Fluid Typography (52 points | 16 comments)
20. Passing the Buck: The story of the 2022 Wings Over Dallas air show collision (58 points | 12 comments)
21. What, if anything, should I do about using Mozilla's Firefox (88 points | 89 comments)
22. Efabless – Shutdown Notice (134 points | 60 comments)
23. Nuclear Reactor Lasers: From fission to photon (2019) (59 points | 7 comments)
24. Why it's so hard to build a jet engine (404 points | 197 comments)
25. Abusing C to implement JSON parsing with struct methods (100 points | 56 comments)
26. What do people see when they're tripping? Analyzing Erowid's trip reports (175 points | 223 comments)
27. Python as a second language empathy (2018) (57 points | 29 comments)
28. Maestro – Next generation mobile UI automation (168 points | 60 comments)
29. China tells its AI leaders to avoid U.S. travel over security concerns (387 points | 373 comments)
30. Emacs Tree-sitter custom highlighting (115 points | 12 comments)
